lead_paragraph: The reappointment of Nguyen Phu Trong is unlikely to alter the country’s strategic balance in relations with China and the United States.
snippet: The reappointment of Nguyen Phu Trong is unlikely to alter the country’s strategic balance in relations with China and the United States.

headline.main: Vietnam’s Communist Party Gives Old-Guard Leader a New 5-Year Term
headline.print_headline: New Term for Leader in Vietnam

abstract: Communist Party of Vietnam reappoints Nguyen Phu Trong, incumbent general secretary, to second five-year term; experts expect leader, member of party's old guard, to maintain close ties with China while seeking to increase cooperation with United States; compliance with recent US-sponsored Pacific Rim trade agreement will require opening of country's economy.
